data.text: @owermohle we want to give people a break from the fire extinguishers now, while the fire has been put out on this side of the house.

@owermohle @ErinBanco And/or maybe cases stopped being the best metric months ago and the cdc finally acted on that to get a more accurate picture…
But sure let’s conspiracy theory this
@owermohle @ErinBanco Has the CDC considered reducing transmissions?
@owermohle @BarbarianCap There’s a state of the union coming up- that explains it 👌🏽

@owermohle Great, and when the hospitalization rates get too high they can change the metrics to deaths. Seriously doubt they will ever reinstate any mandates for future surges, there is no political will anymore.

It's going to be interesting to see how this plays out.

Walensky says "we want to give people a break" from masks when levels are low but "the ability to reach for them again should things get worse in the future." 

That was difficult in practice last summer!

CDC officials spent weeks considering factors that could vastly change the colors on this map and their recommendations, like calculating hospital capacity vs. simply counting cases. W/ @ErinBanco 

https://t.co/2KBZZqP4mM https://t.co/J3D70zx2Lx
@owermohle And what are the metrics with the new format?
